page.title: 01Introducing Bacup and Water
page.content: Bacup and Water are situated in the {Forest of Rossendale}but there is no natural forest now! The surrounding area of hill farms is generally over 1000 feet,very wet with a high annual rainfall. Snow often falls up to April and May. All main roads go along the valleys- the main valley being the Irwell. Water is on the road from Waterfoot to Burnley. Bacup is the larger town built on the River Irwell and at the crossroads of the A671 Burnley to Rochdale and the A681 Todmorden to Rawtenstall. The valley at Water and the town at Bacup are totally different as you can see. We think both have something of interest. Our story is naturally in two parts.
